result.title: Week #6
result.content:
Hello everyone,

Here's the code we wrote during the last session:

Check if a number N is prime in O(sqrt(N)): https://ideone.com/1VjvuX

Finding all divisors of N in O(sqrt(N)): https://ideone.com/xIXTVm

Prime Factorization in O(sqrt(N)): https://ideone.com/B4KVT5

Finding primes up to N in O(NlogN): https://ideone.com/CIzpmv

Finding primes up to N in O(Nlog(logN)) (Sieve of Eratosthenes): https://ideone.com/g2DUKV

Finding sum of divisors for each number from 1 to N in O(NlogN): https://ideone.com/Ar8U3A

GCD and LCM: https://ideone.com/42kqoP

Inclusion-exclusion Principle

Count the numbers between 1 and N divisible by at least one of K given integers (Fast sol vs. Brute Force): https://ideone.com/rj7HgY

Count the number of coprimes with n less than or equal to m: https://ideone.com/hWeho7

Note that the last code is useful in solving problem L — List of Integers.

Resources:

Prime number: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_number

Sieve of Eratosthenes: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sieve_of_Eratosthenes

Greatest common divisor: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greatest_common_divisor

Least common multiple: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Least_common_multiple

Inclusion–exclusion principle: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inclusion–exclusion_principle

Good luck!
